Global

Methods

register(exportObject, packageName, moduleObject)

Register an object under global scope for Node.js and browser.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
exportObject * The object to be exported.
packageName String The package name to be registered. Including namespace name. This parameter will be ignored under Node.js
moduleObject Object The module object. This parameter only works under Node.js.
Source:
  • register.js, line 395
Example
     regsiter(exportObject, "org.cauchies.test", module);

require(packageName, packageNameForBrowser) → {*}

This function only works under browser. Load package with node.js package name or browser package name. Different from Node.js, package name for browser contains package's namespace.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
packageName String Node style package name. Please do not add anything like .js, that will make this program doesn't work.
packageNameForBrowser String <optional>
 Browser package name, including path.
Source:
  • register.js, line 297
Returns:
The package you've load.
Type
*
Example
     var ClObject = require("ClObject");
     var ClObject = require("ClObject", "path.to.ClObject"); //The browser way.

requireJSON(packageName, browserPackageName) → {Object}

Get a json from local or remote file.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
packageName String The package to be loaded.
browserPackageName String <optional>
 The browser package to be loaded.
Source:
  • register.js, line 346
Returns:
Objects we load.
Type
Object
Example
     var obj = requireJSON("error.login");
